abstract: Home Depot agreed yesterday to sell its commercial supply business to an alliance of private equity firms for $8.5 billion, nearly $2 billion less than the original agreement.
snippet: Home Depot agreed yesterday to sell its commercial supply business to an alliance of private equity firms for $8.5 billion, nearly $2 billion less than the original agreement.
lead_paragraph: Home Depot agreed yesterday to sell its commercial supply business to an alliance of private equity firms for $8.5 billion, nearly $2 billion less than the original agreement.

headline.main: Home Depot Sells Unit, With Price Cut
headline.print_headline: Home Depot Sells Unit, With Price Cut

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The really important question about the sale of Home Depot‘s construction supply business apparently isn’t the price, which Home Depot lowered 18 percent on Tuesday, to $8.5 billion, after round-the-clock negotiations.
lead_paragraph: The really important question about the sale of Home Depot‘s construction supply business apparently isn’t the price, which Home Depot lowered 18 percent on Tuesday, to $8.5 billion, after round-the-clock negotiations.

headline.main: Terms Aside, Did Home Depot Give Away the Store?
